title.narrative: Programme indicator 1.2: ILO member states implement policies and programmes that promote more and better jobs and enhance youth employment prospects with a view to inclusive growth and development.
Programme indicator 1.2: ILO member states implement policies and programmes that promote more and better jobs and enhance youth employment prospects with a view to inclusive growth and development.
Programme indicator 9.1: ILO member states adopt fair and effective international labour migration and mobility policies.

description.narrative: Target: 22 member states (all outside Europe) have by the end of 2019 formulated and adopted fair labour migration policies, legislation, bilateral or multilateral agreements for the protection of migrant workers

title.narrative: Programme indicator 9.1: ILO member states adopt fair and effective international labour migration and mobility policies.

description.narrative: Target: 22 member states (all outside Europe) have by the end of 2019 formulated and adopted fair labour migration policies, legislation, bilateral or multilateral agreements for the protection of migrant workers

title.narrative: Programme indicator 2.2: ILO member states pursue a rights-based approach to inclusive and sustainable development in the world of work through tripartite engagement in the ratification and application of international labour standards.

description.narrative: Target: By the end of 2019, 60 Member states have taken action to apply international labour standards, in particular in response to issues raised by the supervisory bodies (tripartite mechanisms established, domestic courts active, monitoring and enforcement by government).

title.narrative: Programme indicator 2.2: ILO member states pursue a rights-based approach to inclusive and sustainable development in the world of work through tripartite engagement in the ratification and application of international labour standards.

description.narrative: Target: By the end of 2019, 60 Member states have taken action to apply international labour standards, in particular in response to issues raised by the supervisory bodies (tripartite mechanisms established, domestic courts active, monitoring and enforcement by government).

title.narrative: Programme indicator A.3: ILO constituents, multilateral and regional organizations and development partners advocate effectively for the inclusion of decent work issues in national sustainable development plans and programmes.

description.narrative: Target: By the end of 2019, 90 per cent of UNDAFs or equivalent planning frameworks, developed in 2016-17, incorporate at least two pillars of the Decent Work Agenda

title.narrative: Programme indicator A.3: ILO constituents, multilateral and regional organizations and development partners advocate effectively for the inclusion of decent work issues in national sustainable development plans and programmes.

description.narrative: Target: By the end of 2019, 90 per cent of UNDAFs or equivalent planning frameworks, developed in 2016-17, incorporate at least two pillars of the Decent Work Agenda
